body_html:
@ebrevdo Perharps, I didn't describe my problem clearly. I did use cell.zero_state to get the varible for the initial state, which works fine. However, when I want to get initial values of the initial state using initial_state.eval(), I got an error saying that AttributeError: 'LSTMStateTuple' object has no attribute 'eval'.

Please see a simplified version of my code below (this code works well when state_is_tuple=False)

        state = lstm.initial_state.eval()
        for step, (x, y) in enumerate(reader.ptb_iterator(train_data,
                                                        batch_size, num_steps)):
            feed_dict = {
                input_data: x, targets: y,
                lstm.initial_state: state
            }
            _cost, state, _ = sess.run(
                [cost, lstm.final_state, train_op],
                feed_dict=feed_dict
            )

The main reason for feeding this initial_state into feed_dict is to propagate the cell's state to the next iteration.

Many Thank
body:
@ebrevdo Perharps, I didn't describe my problem clearly. I did use `cell.zero_state` to get the varible for the initial state, which works fine. However, when I want to get initial values of the initial state using `initial_state.eval()`, I got an error saying that `AttributeError: 'LSTMStateTuple' object has no attribute 'eval'`.

Please see a simplified version of my code below (this code works well when `state_is_tuple=False`)

```
        state = lstm.initial_state.eval()
        for step, (x, y) in enumerate(reader.ptb_iterator(train_data,
                                                        batch_size, num_steps)):
            feed_dict = {
                input_data: x, targets: y,
                lstm.initial_state: state
            }
            _cost, state, _ = sess.run(
                [cost, lstm.final_state, train_op],
                feed_dict=feed_dict
            )
```

The main reason for feeding this initial_state into `feed_dict` is to propagate the cell's state to the next iteration.

Many Thank
